reviews.review_msg: Prof Walsh was fantastic. He taught everything from his notes, and clarified quickly if something wasn't understood. He was mostly approachable, and had plenty of interesting stories which he shared in lecture. Labs were fun, and I would suggest buying the anatomy colouring book. Silly, but an easy way to learn.

straight up...bad prof. his lectures are almost useless to go to because he doesn't really review the notes too much; only talks about how awesome he is. on top of that, he expects you to know every detail of his notes. the labs were fun though and the TA's were great. the class would be great...with another prof

The labs are easily the best part of this course as they are childishly easy but quite fun. Focus on memorization for all exams. Attend his lectures for diagrams he draws, but don't expect to be stimulated apart from his somehwat-funny-at-times jokes. Notes are point by point in a Word document - more or less random facts put together. As for the p

worst teacher ever. I have never given a prof a bad eval, but he deserved it. Does not like to teach which is quite clear as he ends class early all the time(great if you want to pay and not get anything...) tests were unfair but labs were fun as the TAs were great. Avoid this teacher he'll make you quite Kin

this guy is a a horrible professor, i dont know how hes still teaching. his exams barley make sense, and his notes are useless, in every lecture he just goes over irrelevant facts from the notes, and usually talks about his own life stories

he is extremely easy, all you need to do is study is notes and you'll do fine. I got an A, his lectures are very interesting. If you're good at memorizing you'll do fine, and there is no need for you to by the text book.
